data.question: What is the publication year of the article discussing the synthesis and crystal structure of a novel one-dimensional halogen-bridged nickel(III) compound?
Who is one of the authors of the article on the novel one-dimensional halogen-bridged nickel(III) compound?
What is the DOI of the article discussing the synthesis of a novel one-dimensional halogen-bridged nickel(III) compound?
At what temperature were the atomic parameters for [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 measured as per Table II?
What is the bond angle between Ni-N-C(1) at 25°C as per Table IV?
What is the isotropic equivalent thermal parameter (Beq) for Ni at 25°C according to Table I?
Based on the atomic parameters provided, which compound's structure was analyzed at both 25°C and -152°C?
Does the bond distance between Ni-Br(1) change significantly from 25°C to -152°C according to Table IV?
data.answer: No, it changes from 2.580(1) to 2.578(1) Å, which is not significant.

data.question: Is the isotropic thermal parameter for hydrogen atoms higher at -152°C compared to 25°C for [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2?
data.answer: No, it is generally lower at -152°C.

data.question: Can the anisotropic thermal parameters for Ni at 25°C be directly compared to those at -152°C?
data.answer: No, because the parameters are measured under different conditions and scales.

data.question: Is the bond angle N-Ni-Br(1) larger at -152°C than at 25°C?
data.answer: Yes, it increases from 91.7(1) to 92.0(1) degrees.

data.question: Does the compound [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 have a higher isotropic equivalent thermal parameter (Beq) for Ni compared to [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at 25°C?
data.answer: Yes, [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 has a Beq of 1.4 for Ni, which is higher than that of [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2.

data.question: The article was published in the Journal of the American Chemical Society.
The atomic parameters for [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 were measured at 25°C and 100°C.
The isotropic thermal parameter for Br(1) at -152°C is lower than at 25°C for [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2.
The bond distance between Ni-Br(1) is shorter at -152°C than at 25°C.
The article provides atomic parameters for more than one compound.
The bond angle N-Ni-Br(1) decreases significantly from 25°C to -152°C.
The isotropic thermal parameters for hydrogen atoms are provided for both 25°C and -152°C.
The anisotropic thermal parameters for Ni are the same at 25°C and -152°C.
